alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Quitman; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Clay, Randolph, northern Calhoun, Quitman and Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 615 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lakepoint Resort State Park to near Plains. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Dawson, Cuthbert, Shellman, Parrott, Wire Bridge, Carnegie, Watson Crossroads, Ricks Place, Pecan, Dawson Municipal A/P, Chambliss, Hatcher, Morris, Bethel, Springvale, Fort Gaines-Clay Airport, Chickasawhatchee and Wades. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
